name: Bear King
description: The Bear King embodies nature with a regal presence, featuring robust attributes and a blend of physical power and magical prowess. Its fur glistens with magical honey that enhances its attacks.
memorable: With its ability to deal radiant damage and resist various attacks, along with regeneration abilities, the Bear King presents a significant challenge in combat.
goals: To act as a guardian of the wild, protecting nature with its formidable presence and magical abilities.
relations: Often associated with other fey creatures, it may command or ally with woodland spirits or bear folk.
environment: Typically found in enchanted forests or locations dense with wildlife.
strengths: High hit points, strong physical attacks enhanced by radiant damage, magical abilities, and the ability to change shape.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to attacks made with cold iron weapons.
attacks: Employs devastating multiattack options including bites, claws, and a ranged Honey Bolt, all infused with radiant magic.
most_powerful_ability: Honeyed Weapons, which allows its attacks to deal an additional 3d8 radiant damage.
senses: Possesses truesight up to 10 feet and a high passive perception of 18.
skills: Excels in Athletics, Intimidation, and Perception, enhancing its presence in combat and social scenarios.
additional_information: Has legendary resistance, allowing it to succeed on failed saving throws three times a day.
Regenerates hit points when in bear or hybrid forms.
Can restrain targets with magical honey using its Honey Toss ability.
Frightful Roar creates strategic disruption by frightening nearby foes.
Can transform between bear, hybrid, and true Fey forms without losing statistics.
